results.title: Der Rosenkavalier
results.creator_credit: Rank Organisation Film Productions, Poetic Films and Paul Czinner
results.brief_description: Filmed on location at Salzburg during a performance at the Salzburg Festival, Paul Czinner’s production of Richard Strauss’s “Der Rosenkavalier”, an opera in three acts, with libretto by Hugo Von Hofmannsthal, is elegant and quite sumptuous with elaborate sets and costumes. Set in 18th century feudal Vienna during the reign of Empress Maria Theresia, the story revolves around Princess von Werdenberg (Elisabeth Schwarzkopf), her husband Baron Ochs von Lerchenau (Otto Edelmann) and her lover Octavian (Sena Jurinac). Cast also includes Annaliese Rothenberger and Erich Kunz. Features the Vienna State Opera Chorus and Ballet and the Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra conducted by Herbert Von Karajan. Sung in German with story outline before each act in English text.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rank Organisation Film Productions, Poetic Films and Paul Czinner

results.title: Der Rosenkavalier
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, National Video Corporation, Robin Scott and Brian Large
results.brief_description: This opulent new production by Oscar-winning film director John Schlesinger marks the 25th anniversary of Sir Georg Solti’s spectacular debut at the Royal Opera House at Covent Garden. This is an opera in three acts by Richard Strauss, with libretto by Hugo von Hofmannsthal. The music is provided by the Orchestra of the Royal Opera House, conducted by Georg Solti. The scene is Vienna in the early years of the reign of Empress Maria Theresa, the story beginning with the love affair between The Marschallin (Kiri Te Kanawa) the wife of Field Marshall Prince Werdenberg and her latest lover, the young Count Octavian (Anne Howells). The action begins when the Marschallin’s roguish cousin Baron Ochs (Aage Haugland) stumbles into their bed chamber and mistakes the disguised Count for the Marschallin’s woman servant and falls madly in love with her. Complications arise as the noble young Count finds himself falling in love with Och’s betrothed, the enchantingly vulnerable Sophie (Barbara Bonney).
results.creator_credit_for_label: BBC-TV, National Video Corporation, Robin Scott and Brian Large

results.title: Der Freischutz
results.creator_credit: National Video Corporation, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen, Osterreichischer Rundfunk-Fernsehen, Achim Freyer and Hartmut Schottler
results.brief_description: Carl Maria von Weber’s opera “Der Freischutz” with libretto by Friedrich Kind first premiered in Berlin in 1821. This production by Achim Freyer was performed in Stuttgart by the Wurttemberg State Opera Chorus and Orchestra, with Ulrich Eistert as Chorus master and musical direction by Dennis Russell Davies. Romantic, melodramatic, evil and mystical, this German folkloric tale set in the Bohemian forest tells of a rivalry between Max (Toni Kramer) and Kaspar (Wolfgang Probst) over the hand of the beautiful young Agathe (Catarina Ligendza), daughter of Kuno (Fritz Linke) the head Ranger to Prince Ottokar. For Max to be worthy of marrying Agathe, he has to win the traditional shooting contest on his wedding morning. Kaspar has already sold his soul to the devil - will Max do the same? Using colorful set designs, costumes and make-up, this stage performance has a Grimm’s fairytale quality, albeit an adult fairytale. Cast also includes Wolfgang Schone and Raili Viljakainen. Sung in German with no English subtitles. Includes booklet with English translation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: National Video Corporation, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen, Osterreichischer Rundfunk-Fernsehen, Achim Freyer and Hartmut Schottler

results.title: Depression. Addiction
results.creator_credit: Michael Custance, Annie Moore, Discovery Networks Europe and B-line Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Alternative”.
This episode of the fifteen part television series on complementary health focuses on two separate segments: “Depression” (and stress) and “Addiction”. In the first segment on depression, a brief definition and explanation of how and why this emotional illness can cause so much grief, physically and psychically. Explains ‘Melancholic’ and ‘Atypical’ depression and the fact that stress can also be attributed and/or linked to depression. Suggests that learning a better response to depression rather than just trying to cure it would be far more beneficial. By using case studies, the following areas of therapy are discussed and demonstrated: Hypnotherapy; Colour therapy; Reflexology and flower remedy therapy; the Journey therapy. The second segment deals with various forms of addiction with a brief explanation of why some people suffer from this disease (10% of the population have addictive or compulsive behavior problems) and why others don’t. Through various case studies, it covers cannabis, food and alcohol addiction with discussion and demonstration of the following therapies: Homeopathic and Shamanic practice; Hypnotherapy and nutrition; Chinese medicine including acupuncture, Qi Gong and herbal therapy. Commentary by Dilly Barlow.

results.title: Depression
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
We all suffer low spirits occasionally, but when depression becomes a devastating illness it can be life threatening. This program looks at the way manic depressives cope with their illness, its causes and at the type of treatment which is available to them.

results.title: Depreciation and inflation (NP)
results.brief_description: John Cleese plays the foolhardy businessman who thinks he has had a successful year in his factory operation, unaware that inflation and depreciation of capital investment have been eating away at his profits. His crockery and cutlery business has also fallen prey to the clutches of inflation. Cleese’s more astute business friend informs him of his ignorance, providing a clear and simple explanation of the economic concepts. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: Depending on weather
results.brief_description: A driver’s safety depends on the reliability of their car and on their knowledge and experience. As winter approaches racing driver David Mackay checks his car’s reliability to face all weather conditions.

results.title: Departure
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
In Departure, Ian Andrews has used mostly analogue techniques to evoke the decaying process that occurs in a film or photographic image over time, but in doing so, he has created an altogether different visual landscape in which different layers of image contest and compete against each other.
A small strip of found film footage of a man “departing” loops endlessly back and forth, and as it does so, the repeated actions of the man seem to physically alter the layers, the skin of film and image through which we watch this action take place. The figure is marking out the landscape by traversing it, by exiting the frame and leaving a ghostly trace of his presence - but it is the surface of the visual form itself that is left marked.
